name: Composite ID Number and Name
description: The CN data type is used when both an ID number and the associated descriptive name need to be transmitted together. It provides a compact way to send both a coded identifier and its corresponding text description. This data type has been replaced by XCN (Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons) for person-related fields as of HL7 v2.3, but is maintained for backward compatibility and non-person entities.

CN.1.name: ID Number
CN.1.description: The identifier or code value. This component contains the actual ID or code that uniquely identifies the entity.

CN.2.name: Family Name
CN.2.description: The surname or family name associated with the ID. For non-person entities, this may contain the primary name or description.

CN.3.name: Given Name
CN.3.description: The first name or given name associated with the ID. For non-person entities, this may contain additional descriptive information.

CN.4.name: Middle Initial or Name
CN.4.description: Middle name or initial. For non-person entities, this may contain supplementary descriptive text.

CN.5.name: Suffix
CN.5.description: Name suffix such as Jr., Sr., III. For non-person entities, this may contain classification or type information.

CN.6.name: Prefix
CN.6.description: Name prefix such as Dr., Mr., Ms. For non-person entities, this may contain category or classification prefixes.

CN.7.name: Degree
CN.7.description: Academic degree or professional designation such as MD, RN, PhD. For non-person entities, this may contain certification or standard information.

CN.8.name: Source Table
CN.8.description: Identifies the source table or coding system from which the ID number is drawn. Provides context for the identifier.

constraints.usage: At least one component should be populated for meaningful identification
constraints.personVsEntity: Different usage patterns for person identifiers vs. entity identifiers
constraints.replacement: For person identification, XCN is preferred in HL7 v2.3 and later

generationHints.typical: Use realistic identifiers appropriate for the entity type being identified
generationHints.personPattern: Follow name conventions for healthcare providers when used for persons
generationHints.entityPattern: Use descriptive naming for equipment, departments, or other entities
generationHints.context: Consider whether the identifier represents a person or entity

usagePatterns.legacyPerson: Historical person identification before XCN adoption
usagePatterns.mixed: Systems handling both persons and entities with same data type

validationRules.minimumPopulation: At least CN.1 or CN.2 should be populated for meaningful identification
validationRules.lengthConstraints: All components must respect their maximum length limitations
validationRules.sourceTableValidation: CN.8 should reference valid coding system when populated
validationRules.contextualValidation: Content should be appropriate for the type of entity being identified

migrationNotes.compatibility: CN maintained for backward compatibility and non-person entities
migrationNotes.recommendation: Use XCN for new person identification implementations
